data.title: Ex-FTX US President criticizes crypto leverage trading, launching perpetual futures for traditional assets to mitigate risk.
data.description: A former executive from FTX US is introducing a perpetual futures exchange focused on traditional assets, aiming to steer clear of the inherent risks associated with cryptocurrencies. The initiative seeks to tap into the growing demand for alternate investment options within the traditional asset space.

data.title: Pacific Cascade Legal in Tacoma, Wash., celebrating National Adoption Month by highlighting its commitment to supporting families of all types through adoption.
data.description: In Tacoma, Washington on November 1, 2025, Pacific Cascade Legal, a family law firm, is observing National Adoption Month by emphasizing their dedication to assisting families navigate the adoption process. The firm aims to support families of all types, including first-time adopters and blended families.

data.title: iGarden launches pre-sale of Swim Jet P Series, the perfect swim jet for home pools. Nov 1, 2025.
data.description: Announced on November 1, 2025, iGarden, a sub-brand of Fairland Group that focuses on Artful Living Technology for innovative backyard solutions, has officially launched the pre-sale of its Swim Jet P Series. This new product release signifies a major advancement for the company in the realm of backyard technology.

data.title: SiLC Technologies announces new facility in the U.S. to expand global manufacturing capacities.
data.description: A new study revealed that over 1,000 people were surveyed about their shopping habits during the holiday season. The results showed that 65% of participants planned to spend more money on gifts this year compared to last year. Additionally, 42% of those surveyed admitted to overspending during the holidays in the past. The study also found that most respondents (78%) felt pressured to buy expensive gifts for their loved ones. The survey provided insights into consumer behavior and financial habits during the festive season, highlighting the trend of increased holiday spending.

data.title: DEMIRE predicts sales opportunities next year, will not make early partial bond repayment at year-end.
data.description: DEMIRE anticipates leveraging sales opportunities to boost revenue next year and has decided against making an early partial repayment of the bond at the end of the year.

data.title: Miami-based startup Flamingo enters MSP market with AI platform OpenFrame, attracting 1,000 MSPs (3% market share) pre-launch.
data.description: In Miami Beach, Florida, a startup named Flamingo has emerged from stealth mode with the release of OpenFrame, a platform that merges AI automation with open-source infrastructure. This platform aims to transform the economics of managed service providers (MSPs), which are firms offering IT support to small and medium-sized enterprises.Before the official launch, Flamingo has garnered significant interest, with over 1,000 MSPs signing up on the waitlist. This number accounts for around 3% of the market for managed services. Additionally, more than 150 early adopters are actively engaged in testing out the platform.

data.title: Fed cut interest rate by 0.25%, Miran dissented for 0.5% cut; Wolfers criticizes decision as 'utterly incoherent.'
data.description: The Federal Reserve reduced its benchmark interest rate by 0.25% amid sharp internal dissent and external criticism of Governor Stephen Miran for advocating a larger 0.5% cut. The 10-2 vote by the Federal Open Market Committee showcased a clear split on monetary policy. The majority opted for a target range of 3.75% to 4%, while Miran urged a more aggressive decrease. Kansas City Fed President Jeffrey R. Schmid dissented, favoring no change in rates. Economist Justin Wolfers criticized Miran's argument as incoherent. Wolfers linked Miran's stance to his recent appointment by President Donald Trump. The full story is accessible on Benzinga.com.

data.title: CIBC Innovation Banking funds zLinq, telecom management provider, for new product Telfinity, aiding enterprise clients.
data.description: In Denver, CIBC Innovation Banking has revealed that it is extending growth financing to bolster zLinq, a prominent player in offering telecommunications lifecycle management solutions to corporate customers. zLinq specializes in aiding IT departments in the selection, implementation, supervision, and enhancement of voice and data assets within the realm of telecommunications. The funding is geared towards facilitating the creation of Telfinity, a fresh product that establishes a constructive boundary between intricate telecom providers and IT units. This move comes as part of CIBC Innovation Banking's initiative to support zLinq's innovative endeavors as they continue to cater to enterprise clients.

data.title: Stock market advances as Dow Jones, S&P 500 set new records, with futures higher following positive trade negotiations with China. UPS earnings beat expectations, stock climbs 12.08% in premarket. Fed likely to cut rates with 97.8% probability. Treasury bond yields at 3.48% for 10-year and 3.50% for two-year.
data.description: On Tuesday, U.S. stock futures bounced back after reaching a new record on Monday due to positive developments in U.S.-China trade negotiations. The Federal Reserve will announce its interest rate decision on Wednesday, with market projections showing a high likelihood of a rate cut in October. The 10-year Treasury bond yielded 3.48% and the two-year bond at 3.50%. The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) was down 0.083% at $685.81, while the Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (QQQ) rose 0.16% to $629.11 in premarket trading. United Parcel Service Inc. (UPS) saw a 12.08% increase in premarket trading after reporting earnings of $1.55 per share for the third quarter, above the expected $1.31 per share, with revenue of $21.4 billion, exceeding estimates. UPS maintained a strong short-term price trend but a weaker trend in the medium and long terms.

data.title: AUCC and Mastercard partnership to launch 2025 Data Challenge for HBCU students to drive inclusive growth.
data.description: In Atlanta on November 1, 2025, the Atlanta University Center Consortium (AUCC) Data Science Initiative (DSI) announced a collaboration with the Mastercard Center for Inclusive Growth to introduce the 2025 Mastercard Data Challenge. This competition aims to inspire students from Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) across the country to leverage data.

data.title: S&P 500 up 75%, job openings down 33%. Debate sparked over AI vs. Fed policy. Expert calls chart "scariest."
data.description: A widely circulated chart depicting the S&P 500 index soaring while job openings plummet has raised concerns about the division of the American economy possibly caused by artificial intelligence. The chart gained attention following the introduction of ChatGPT in November 2022, showing a remarkable 70% surge in the S&P 500 alongside a significant 30% decrease in job openings. Journalist Derek Thompson, in a recent Substack post, referred to this graph as "the scariest chart in the world," noting its complexity. Data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics revealed that job openings hit a peak of 11.5 million in March 2022, dropping to 7.18 million by August 2025. During the same period, the S&P 500 index climbed from around 3,840 to close to 6,700, marking a 74% increase. Thompson attributed this economic divide not to AI but to the Federal Reserve's monetary tightening measures as per reports from Fortune. Further insights on this issue can be found in the full article available on Benzinga.com.

data.title: DC economy hit hard by shutdown, consumer spending falls like during 2008 crisis. Spending down 1.4% YoY, shutdown day 27, could last a record 35 days.
data.description: The prolonged federal government shutdown in Washington D.C. is severely impacting the economy, with consumer spending plummeting at rates not seen since the 2008 financial crisis. Data from the Bank of America Institute revealed a 1.4% decline in year-over-year credit and debit card spending in the week ending Oct. 18, marking the most significant drop since the financial crisis aftermath. Economist David Michael Tinsley attributes this sharp decrease to D.C. residents scaling back due to the shutdown, now in its 27th day. With no end in sight, the uncertainty has led to a 78% probability per Kalshi betting market that the shutdown could exceed 35 days, potentially extending until November 13. This situation is causing considerable economic strain and could disrupt consumer behavior leading up to Thanksgiving.

data.title: Ibotta's 'Thanksgiving on Us' program offers cashback on holiday groceries, 61% shoppers concerned about inflation.
data.description: Denver-based company Ibotta (NYSE: IBTA) has initiated its Thanksgiving program to start the holiday season. Ibotta, known for the largest digital promotions network in North America, is offering Savers cashback on Thanksgiving grocery essentials this year. The company's 2025 Holiday Outlook reveals that 61% of shoppers are worried about inflation affecting their holiday budget. This year marks the sixth consecutive year of Ibotta's 'Thanksgiving on Us' campaign, aiming to assist in providing food for the holiday celebrations.

data.title: Dr. Keith Harris is chosen as Freed-Hardeman University's 17th President after an extensive search.
data.description: In Henderson, Tennessee on November 1, 2025, Freed-Hardeman University's Board of Trustees concluded a thorough search and appointed Dr. Keith Harris from Lewisville, Texas as the upcoming president of FHU. Dr. Harris will assume the role after David R. Shannon's term concludes at the conclusion of the 2025-26 academic year.

data.title: AI stocks that demonstrate revenue or strategic advantage thrive, as Amazon and Google excel, but Meta and Microsoft face setbacks in the fast-evolving technology market.
data.description: As artificial intelligence continues to gain attention, certain AI stocks are standing out by either generating substantial revenue or gaining a competitive advantage through this rapidly evolving technology. Companies like Amazon and Google have excelled in this regard, while Meta and Microsoft experienced a decline in their stock value. The overall sentiment among investors suggests that AI companies are facing a critical moment requiring tangible results to justify their market standing.

data.title: Kessler Topaz Meltzer & Check, LLP investigating CarMax, Inc. for securities violations, urges investors with losses to contact.
data.description: In Radnor, Pennsylvania on November 1, 2025, the firm Kessler Topaz Meltzer & Check, LLP is looking into possible breaches of federal securities laws for investors of CarMax, Inc. (NYSE: KMX). This investigation stems from developments on September 25, 2025, when CarMax made public announcements.

data.title: HAOQI E-Bikes launches 2025 Black Friday promo for Cheetah2.0 Dual Battery E-Bike, available from Nov 1-Dec 3.
data.description: In Fremont, California, on November 1, 2025, HAOQI E-Bikes, a well-known electric bike company, revealed details of their upcoming Black Friday sale for 2025. The promotion will showcase the highly sought-after Cheetah2.0 Dual Battery Full Suspension E-Bike. Running from November 1 to December 3, 2025, customers will have the opportunity to take advantage of...

data.title: Berkshire's Q3 earnings rose 34%, with a 216% surge in insurance underwriting profit to $2.369 billion. Warren Buffett hands off the crown.
data.description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc. recently announced a significant increase in its operating earnings by 34% during the third quarter, primarily due to a surge in insurance profits. The company, led by 95-year-old Warren Buffett, made a major acquisition of OxyChem, marking its largest move since 2022. Operating earnings for the Omaha-based company rose to $13.49 billion in the latest quarter, representing a 33.6% increase. A key highlight was the 216% surge in insurance-underwriting profit, totaling $2.369 billion for the quarter, a significant rise from the previous year. However, there was a 13.18% decline in insurance-investment income. For the full story, it is available on Benzinga.com.
